title: An ordinance of both houses of Parliament for the safeguard of the Parliament, tower and City of London, under the command of Serjeant Major Generall Skippon.
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
publisher: February 18. London, printed for Joseph Hunscott,
notes: Refers to order of Parliament, 12 January last, to place a guard about the tower under Maj. Gen. Skippon, commander of the Guards of Parliament. This has been done, and the guards posted at the end of Tower Street and elsewhere. His dispositions are approved of as being for the real good service of King and Parliament. Any person arresting or troubling him violates the privilege of Parliament. -- Cf. Steele.
Dates are given according to Lady Day dating.
Reproduction of the original in the Christ Church Library, Oxfor d.
